page.title: 12RAILWAYS-BODMIN PARKWAY
page.content: Bodmin Parkway station is situated off the A38 to Plymouth. It is 3 miles out side of Bodmin and is one of the main stations in Cornwall. In the 1980's the name has been changed from Bodmin Road Station to Bodmin Parkway because of the large parking area. The station is fairly old and has recently been simplified with electronics. The old signal box has been taken down and replaced by lights.A bridge crosses high above the track to take you from the car-park to the ticket office. The station is in the area of Glynn Valley through which the River Fowey runs and it is surrounded by woodland. The station also has its own taxi and bus service.
